heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 26 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-easterly (145°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 85.0 degrees.    In the UK, a south-easterly wind can bring cold and damp weather (especially in the winter.)

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 472 m), dew point temperature (down 1.5°C), and inside temperature (up 1.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 620.3m lower than yesterday, 302.1m lower than the past week, 472.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 789m and a peak of 2540m, averaging 851.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dark. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
